page.title: 13Crichel Estate Farms
page.content: WHITE FARM Stock: there are 986 head of cattle, mainly Friesians and 3 Hereford bulls 606 de_horned Friesian cows. 136 in_calf heifers 110 bulling heifers 131 calves in Autumn '85 (estimated) The Friesian heifers are cross_bred with Hereford bulls to produce first calves for beef. Most dairy cows are kept for 7_9 years, the cows spend Summer out but Winter in at White Farm and Dean Farm. There is computerised milking in a low_line herringbone milking parlour. The milk from this dairy is collected in 2 large stainless steel storage tanks, each holding 750 gallons; the milk is then sent to Portsmouth where it is processed by the Milk Marketing Board. The yield on 31.5.1985 was 9882 litres.
